thread.title: Chris Mintz GoFundMe campaign, started by cousin, goes viral
thread.title_full: Chris Mintz GoFundMe campaign, started by cousin, goes viral | OregonLive.com

author: Andrew Theen | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Chris Mintz GoFundMe campaign, started by cousin, goes viral
text:
Updated: This post was updated with more recent figures of the GoFundMe campaign. Read our profile of Mintz to learn more about him.
Chris Mintz, the 30-year-old father and Army veteran who was shot seven times on Thursday during a mass shooting in Roseburg, continues to trend nationally on social media networks.
A funding campaign to raise money for Mintz's medical bills, started by his cousin Derek Bourgeois, also went viral.
After just five hours, the GoFundMe campaign had raised more than $200,000 from at least 5,770 people across the nation.
By 5:00 p.m., the same account had more than $377,000.
The Oregonian/OregonLive talked to Mintz's family, friends and a former neighbor on Friday.
Read that story here: Chris Mintz was always one to 'cowboy up'
Here's what people are saying on Twitter, where Mintz continues to trend nationally:
Restoring my faith in people. GoFundMe for Chris Mintz, hero in shooting raises $150k in 5 hours https://t.co/eX8gN0dhhv . Give if you can.
— Nicole Sandler (@nicolesandler) October 2, 2015
Mad respect to Chris Mintz for not only being a vet, and a father but also a selfless hero. #StillBreathin https://t.co/F6zCy4pmk2
— Brenden Dilley (@Hublife) October 2, 2015
I'm so PROUD of my brother *ARMY* veteran, Chris Mintz! A ***BIG*** "HOOAH!" to you, brave soldier! #BeAllYouCanBe pic.twitter.com/1Ul61qJdCW
— LTC Hunter (@LTC_Hunter) October 2, 2015
Cheers to you, Chris Mintz, for protecting our country, even when you didn't have to. Here's to a speedy and full recovery ❤️
— Madison McLaughlin (@MadisonMcLaugh) October 2, 2015
